SEARCH
Package com.kneelawk.graphlib.api.util.graph

Class Graph<T,L>

java.lang.Object
com.kneelawk.graphlib.api.util.graph.Graph<T,L>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of data this graph contains in each node.
L - the type of link data this graph contains between nodes.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Node<T,L>>
public final class Graph<T,L> extends Object implements Iterable<Node<T,L>>
General purpose graph data structure.

      public Graph()

  • Method Details

    • add

      @NotNull public @NotNull Node<T,L> add(T data)
      Adds a node to this graph containing the given data.
      Parameters:
      data - the data for the new node to contain.
      Returns:
      the new node.

    • remove

      public void remove(@NotNull @NotNull Node<T,L> node)
      Removes a node from this graph.

      Note: this does not perform graph splitting. That must be done separately.

      Parameters:
      node - the node to remove.

    • split

      @NotNull public @NotNull List<Graph<T,L>> split()
      Splits all disconnected sets of nodes off into their own graphs.

      Note: this graph will always retain the largest body of nodes, returning the smaller bodies in the list.

      Returns:
      the new graphs made from the disconnected nodes.

    • moveBulkUnchecked

      public void moveBulkUnchecked(@NotNull @NotNull Graph<T,L> into, @NotNull @NotNull Set<Node<T,L>> nodes)
      Moves nodes from this graph into the given graph.

      WARNING: This does not check node connections. Misuse can result in nodes being connected to other nodes that are not in the same graph. This also does not check if the nodes already existed in the origin or destination graphs.

      Parameters:
      into - the graph nodes are being moved into.
      nodes - the nodes to be moved.

    • join

      public void join(@NotNull @NotNull Graph<T,L> other)
      Joins this graph with another graph, moving all its nodes into this graph.
      Parameters:
      other - the other graph to join with.

    • link

      @NotNull public @NotNull Link<T,L> link(@NotNull @NotNull Node<T,L> a, @NotNull @NotNull Node<T,L> b, @NotNull L linkKey)
      Links two nodes.
      Parameters:
      a - the first node to link.
      b - the second node to link.
      linkKey - the key for the new link.
      Returns:
      the link between the two nodes.

    • link

      public boolean link(@NotNull @NotNull Link<T,L> newLink)
      Links the two nodes in a link object.
      Parameters:
      newLink - the link object describing the link to be created.
      Returns:
      true the two nodes were not previously linked already, false otherwise.

    • unlink

      public boolean unlink(@NotNull @NotNull Node<T,L> a, @NotNull @NotNull Node<T,L> b, @NotNull L linkKey)
      Unlinks two nodes.

      Note: this tries unlinking in both directions, so node order is not an issue.

      Parameters:
      a - the first node to unlink.
      b - the second node to unlink.
      linkKey - the key of the link to be removed.
      Returns:
      true if a link was removed from both nodes, false otherwise.

    • unlink

      public boolean unlink(@NotNull @NotNull Link<T,L> link)
      Unlinks the two nodes in a link object.

      Note: this tries unlinking in both directions, so node order is not an issue.

      Parameters:
      link - the link object describing the link to be removed.
      Returns:
      true if a link was removed from both nodes, false otherwise.
